GisSemaphore Class Reference

#include <GisSemaphore.h>

Inherits GisIDisposable.

Inheritance diagram for GisSemaphore:

[legend]
List of all members.

Detailed Description

GisSemaphore is a semaphore class. It is used to prevent operations from happening concurrently or re-entrantly. GisSemaphore is not currently part of the GIS API but can be added if there is a demand. It is a wrapper class around a boolean semaphore.

DOXYGEN-IGNORE

GisSemaphore can be used to prevent a member function on another class from being called re-entrantly for the same object (see GisXmlReaderXrcs::Parse()) for an example. This can be done by declaring a GisSemaphoreP, at the start of the function, that takes a boolean member and an exception. The boolean member must initially be false. When the GisSemaphoreP is created, the boolean member is set to true. When the function exits, GisSemaphoreP goes out of scope and sets the boolean member back to false. However, if the function is called a second time before the first invokation finishes, the second GisSemaphoreP created will detect that the boolean member is true, and it will throw the given exception, thus rejecting the re-entrant function call.
